title: Decay - Po-210 to Pb-206 - what is emitted

content.question: A polonium-<math alttext="210" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>210</mn></math> atom <math alttext="P o with mass number 210 and atomic number 82" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>Po</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>82</mn><mn>210</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>)</mo></math> decays to lead-<math alttext="206" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>206</mn></math> <math alttext="P b with mass number 206 and atomic number 80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>Pb</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>80</mn><mn>206</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>)</mo></math>. Which of the following must have occurred during the process?

choices.label: Both a beta-plus particle and a neutrino were emitted.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
